original_solution_mapping.L1: Jessica will drive 20 minutes, twice every school day (to and from school), so 20 minutes x 2 trips = <<20*2=40>>40 minutes each day.
original_solution_mapping.L2: There are 60 minutes in 1 hour, so 50 hours of driving x 60 minutes/hour = <<50*60=3000>>3,000 minutes.
original_solution_mapping.L3: If you take the 3,000 minutes she needs to drive / 40 minutes driving each day = <<3000/40=75>>75 school days to drive 50 hours.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2136.
    Returns: the number of school days it will take Jessica to meet the driving requirement.
    """
    # L1
    minutes_to_school = 20 # It takes 20 minutes to drive to school
    trips_per_day = 2 # to and from school
    minutes_per_day = minutes_to_school * trips_per_day

    # L2
    required_hours = 50 # 50 hours of driving
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # 60 minutes in 1 hour
    hours_in_hour = 1 # 1 hour
    required_minutes = required_hours * minutes_per_hour

    # L3
    school_days_needed = required_minutes / minutes_per_day

    # FA
    answer = school_days_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Jessica will drive {minutes_to_school} minutes, twice every school day (to and from school), so {minutes_to_school} minutes x {trips_per_day} trips = <<{minutes_to_school}*{trips_per_day}={minutes_per_day}>>{minutes_per_day} minutes each day.

There are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in {hours_in_hour} hour, so {required_hours} hours of driving x {minutes_per_hour} minutes/hour = <<{required_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={required_minutes}>>{required_minutes} minutes.

If you take the {required_minutes} minutes she needs to drive / {minutes_per_day} minutes driving each day = <<{required_minutes}/{minutes_per_day}={school_days_needed}>>{school_days_needed} school days to drive {required_hours} hours.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Jessica will drive 20 minutes, twice every school day (to and from school), so 20 minutes x 2 trips = <<20*2=40>>40 minutes each day.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: There are 60 minutes in 1 hour, so 40 hours of driving x 60 minutes/hour = <<40*60=2400>>2400 minutes.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: If you take the 2400 minutes she needs to drive / 40 minutes driving each day = <<2400/40=60>>60 school days to drive 50 hours.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'minutes_per_day' (40) was used instead of 'required_hours' (50).
